Topic.Title: Right Wing Maroons Say Nothing About Gas Prices

Message.Msg: wingnut - you have NO clue about the Energy sector in which I trade/invest in very heavely and been doing so since 1996! New data which suggests that we have twice the amount of oil and NG then we thought, the drilling in the private - not federal land, because Obimbo doesn't allow it - and eventually the building of the Keystone pipeline (if Obimbo allows it or not) is bringing prices down. ND alone has "unlimited supply"! Next because of the miserable economy created by Obimbo, the lay offs, the unemployment and reduction in manufactureing is bringing demand down - so the prices fall! Also the belt tightening by the traveling/vacationing public leaves the pumps full! As to NG, it might not even pay off to drill any more new wells at this time or the "shipping costs" are going to be higher then the product! We could be independent, supplying our own needed supplies and the Arabs will beg us to buy their oil - there is only so much India, China and Japan is going to need - especially China investing in nuclear power and NG to switch away from oil! So get your facts straight beofre you make #$%$ statements! Based on Supply and Demand, I can see Gasoline dropping to an average of $3.50 and up here in the north to $3.25 and below $3 with the discount cards - I already filled last week paying $3.32! ROWDY

Topic.Title: Volume is very subdued today

Message.Msg: Is cool by me, I grabbed up a short term options position at the end of yesterdays trading session hoping for a "bounce back" on clarification and a mental "settling in period" for the new management. This in addition to be cumulative on a "no particular logical reason" down day. So far it seems to be working out alright, as though the volume may be low, the price is going the right direction. Seems unfair that the position with the highest overall unrealized gain is one I bought less than 24 hours before.

Message.Msg: Yes it will be. My position? Long & always buying more.

Topic.Title: FORECAST: In 20 Years E-Trade Is The Worlds Largest Bank!

Message.Msg: I like to maintain a core position and trade in and out of it. That way I can see SOME short term profits on the way to long term profits and earn funds to expand my permanent position (also it spreads the gains out a bit if you're like me on a fixed income and won't be taxed unless you exceed like 17.5k or so in short term gains). Long term gains are wonderful as you have to have more than a quarter million (as a couple) in income from all sources before they start to be taxable at all. I have another 500 shares of ETrade in my permanent position that will be long term as of tomorrow.

Topic.Title: FORECAST: In 20 Years E-Trade Is The Worlds Largest Bank!

Message.Msg: You sound like a smart whippersnapper! Trading "in and out" is certainly tons of fun,& full of risk, but we are all tempted, and we do often do it. When a stock like CSCO or MSFT or INTC or ETFC makes a big move you can end up missing the big dollars. So with ETFC just buy and don't trade. This can triple, or at least double sometime, in a single weeks time. Bull markets do come and my guess is that we are in the first 3 months of a brand new ten year "bull cycle" right about now. I know that everyone is talking drop but it will simply not happen this time as there is too much liquidity floating around. It's going to take ten years for this massive amount of liquidity to finally start to vaporize. Then the same sort of crash, like the one of of 1929, will finally come and Ben will be powerless to do anything about it. But America will recover, similarly to, as it did way back then. Happy investing to you! The 10 year bull market is only three months new today!

Message.Title: The rich love Obama
Message.Msg: **"A largely jobless recovery coupled with a Quantitative-Easing-fueled stock market rally seems to earn more smiles from the upscale among us** Another liberal falsehood falls. With the markets at all time highs thanks to Obama's lousy economy which has forced Bernanke to keep the printing pressing rolling @ the clip of 85 billion a month, the rich seem to be the ones on the winning end of this administrations redistribution policy. The poor get Obama phones and the rich get Obama Gulfstream jets, while the folks in the middle get the shaft. Wealthy, not middle class, support Obama President Obama's approval numbers are starting to mimic Mitt Romney's. According to a new Economist/YouGov poll, it's the rich -- not the poor or middle class -- who back Obama more despite his 2012 campaign attacking the rich. The poll found that fewer than half of those with incomes less than $100,000 per year approve of Obama's performance, while he enjoys a 54 percent approval rating among those with incomes higher than that. Those earning less than $40,000 a year disapprove of the president's performance, 51 percent to 45 percent. Those earning $40,000 to $100,000 disapprove by a rate of 50 percent to 48 percent. "A largely jobless recovery coupled with a Quantitative-Easing-fueled stock market rally seems to earn more smiles from the upscale among us, fewer from the working class," said the pollsters.

Topic.Title: FORECAST: In 20 Years E-Trade Is The Worlds Largest Bank!

Message.Msg: I traded out of positions I just took on the 1st on the 2nd. 500 shares and 10 options contracts. Didn't make much in dollars terms, but in percentage versus time terms it was fairly awesome. Bought the options right at yesterdays bottom sold them near todays top, and picked up a 31 cent or so spread on the shares. I figured it wasn't bad for 22.5 hours "work" and meantime if the stock went ballistic the next minute, well, I still had my 3500 shares left. 2500 shares core position and 1000 shares over still even after selling the 500 shares, it's just that those other shares my or may not sell as quickly, since i have more time to fiddle since todays sales pulled me away from the edge of my margin requirements.
